info.name: Replace Broken Avatars On Discogs
info.description: Discogs avatars (user icons) can be images uploaded to Discogs or Gravatar. If you block Gravatar for privacy purposes, or if a user account is disabled, some icons will be missing/broken. This style hides those broken images and effectively replaced them with the generic Gravatar icon, generated internally. Avatars hosted by Discogs will still work.
info.additionalInfo: Originally posted by Discogs user mjb (that's me) on 25 Aug 2015, improved 16 Feb 2016 (forum post), and updated 23 Oct 2019 to additionally handle avatars for deleted user accounts. The screenshot of a forum thread is showing all three types of images. The first user had a Gravatar-hosted image which has been blocked (e.g. by uMatrix rule * gravatar.com * block) and is now replaced with a generic avatar stored in the CSS. The second user's icon is a normal Discogs-hosted image, still working as it should. The third user's account is deleted and their avatar is normally a broken image, but now shows as the generic avatar.
